description.narrative: The Mekong Delta is the most important rice-producing region in Vietnam, accounting for more than half the annual rice production. Shrimp is the most valuable commodity for the region, producing about 40% of the country’s earnings from seafood. Rice and shrimp have been farmed in rotation in the Mekong Delta for 40 years, but are producing declining yields due to increasing salinity and recurrent shrimp disease outbreaks. The overall aim of this project is to increase yields and profitability of rice-shrimp production systems in the Mekong Delta. It also aims to ensure these systems can adapt to environmental change and its effect on pond soil and water quality.
